aboutLong:
Ernest Bernin is a doctoral candidate in chemistry at [University Name]. His research focuses on developing new synthetic methods and understanding the mechanistic principles that enable selective transformations. He combines experimental work with careful data analysis to turn observations into clear chemical insight.

Ernest also contributes to teaching and mentorship through TA roles, peer advising, and outreach activities aimed at making chemistry more accessible.

research.title: Synthetic Organic Chemistry
research.description: Designing efficient, selective routes to complex molecules and functional building blocks.

research.title: Catalysis & Mechanisms
research.description: Developing catalytic methods and probing mechanisms using kinetics and spectroscopy.

research.title: Computational Chemistry
research.description: Using modeling to interpret experiments, predict reactivity, and guide molecular design.
